Key Match Events: Harry Kane scored a goal for England in the first half.
Morten Hjulmand scored for Denmark equalizing the game in the 34th minute.
Phil Foden hit the post with a left-foot effort from the edge of the area.
Pre-Game Insights: Gareth Southgate's approach was questioned as England struggled to maintain fluidity with the creative duo of Phil Foden and Jude Bellingham.
There were speculations that the experiment of playing Trent Alexander-Arnold in a central midfield role might be abandoned.
Captain Harry Kane was substituted for Ollie Watkins in the second half.
Post-Match Reflections: Southgate and his team have work to do according to the reaction from the public and press.
Declan Rice gave away the ball in the final moments of the game, leading to a desperation tackle from Marc Guehi.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game took place on a poor surface that regularly chopped up over the course of the evening.
Christian Eriksen tied his country's all-time record by making his 132nd international appearance.
Denmark kept its hopes alive and could still win the group if it beats Serbia on Tuesday.
